intro: Carpodinus leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered carpodine, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its attractive, white, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a small, fleshy berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
